questions.questionText: Which statement about acceleration is correct?

options.A: It is related to the changing speed of an object.
options.B: It is the distance an object travels in one second.
options.C: It is the force acting on an object divided by the distance it travels in one second.
options.D: It is the force acting on an object when it is near to the Earth.

questions.questionText: Which statement correctly describes the effects of placing a heavy load in a car?

options.A: It is easier to accelerate the car and easier to bring the car to rest.
options.B: It is easier to accelerate the car but more difficult to bring the car to rest.
options.C: It is more difficult to accelerate the car and more difficult to bring the car to rest.
options.D:
It is more difficult to accelerate the car but easier to bring the car to rest.

questions.questionText: The mass of a measuring cylinder is 190 g. 400 cm^3 of liquid is put into the measuring cylinder. The total mass of the measuring cylinder and the liquid is 560 g. Four solid objects are lowered in turn into the liquid. The densities of the objects are shown. 1 0.40 g / cm^3 2 0.90 g / cm^3 3 1.2 g / cm^3 4 2.7 g / cm^3 Which objects will float in the liquid?

options.A:
man of weight 800 N walks along the beam from P to Q.

questions.questionText: Which quantity is a vector?

The diagram shows part of a rollercoaster ride with the car at different positions. The car runs freely down from position X to position Y and up the hill on the other side. X #### Y car What happens to the kinetic energy and to the gravitational potential energy of the car as itmoves from position X to position Y? kinetic energy (^) potential energygravitational
Which energy resource does **not** have the Sun as the original source?

The diagram shows a solid block resting on a bench. The dimensions of the block are shown. 80 cm^ bench 20 cm 40 cm #### P R #### Q On which labelled surface should the block rest to produce the smallest pressure on the bench?

options.D: P, Q and R produce the same pressure

questions.questionText: The pressure due to the liquid on an object immersed in that liquid is 4500 Pa. The density of the liquid is 900 kg / m^3. What is the depth of the object below the surface of the liquid?

options.A: The average distance between molecules increases.
options.B: The average kinetic energy of the molecules increases.
options.C: The mass of each molecule increases.
options.D:
The volume of each molecule increases.

questions.questionText: Water in a beaker evaporates when left on a bench for a period of time. Which three factors all affect the rate of evaporation of the water?
The diagrams show four blocks of steel. The blocks are all drawn to the same scale. The same quantity of thermal energy is given to each block. Which block shows the greatest rise in temperature? **
Why are metals better thermal conductors than other solids?

options.A: Metals contain free electrons which help transfer the energy.
options.B: Molecules in metals are in fixed positions.
options.C: Molecules in metals can move freely.
options.D:
Molecules in metals vibrate faster than those in other solids.

questions.questionText: Two freezers X and Y are identical except that one has a door opening at the front and the otherhas a door opening at the top. #### X freezer door Y freezer door
The diagram shows a wave. 8 cm 4 cm 3 cm 6 cm What are the amplitude and the wavelength of this wave? amplitude / cm wavelength / cm
Which statement is correct?

options.A: The speed of light in glass is equal to the speed of light in a vacuum multiplied by the refractive index of glass.
options.B: The incident angle of a light ray at an air-glass surface is the angle between the ray and the glass surface.
options.C: The sine of the critical angle at an air-glass surface is equal to (^) refractiveindex^1 ofglass.
options.D:
The angle of refraction for light passing through an air-glass surface is proportional to theangle of incidence at that surface.

questions.questionText: Sound travels through air as a series of compressions and rarefactions. Which statement correctly compares a compression with a rarefaction?

options.A: In a compression the wavelength is longer than in a rarefaction.
options.B: In a compression the wavelength is shorter than in a rarefaction.
options.C: In a compression the density of the air is greater than in a rarefaction.
options.D:
In a compression the density of the air is lower than in a rarefaction.

questions.questionText: The circuit shows one method of magnetising a steel bar. + – steel bar How can the circuit be altered so that it can be used to demagnetise the magnetised steel bar?

options.A: remove the steel bar from the coil whilst the current is switched on
options.B: replace the d.c. supply with an a.c. supply and gradually reduce the supply voltage to zero
options.C: reverse the polarity of the d.c. supply
options.D:
reverse the polarity of the d.c. supply and gradually reduce the supply voltage to zero
